item.title: Featured App: A New Home for Charlie the Chocolate Chihuahua
item.dc:creator: Rob Miracle
item.description: A New Home for Charlie the Chocolate Chihuahua is an interactive book app from Fat Red Couch. Click through to earn more about this app.
item.content:encoded:
Corona developers are creating some fantastic apps. Today Corona Labs would like to feature, A New Home for Charlie the Chocolate Chihuahua, an interactive book from Fat Red Couch, Inc.

Charlie the Chocolate Chihuahua is a story about a small dog making friends in his new home. Get to know characters like Rockin’ Rob Robin and Shearl, the tailless squirrel while playing interactive games that include puzzles, painting and drawing, interactive sounds and more.

Artwork can be saved to the gallery for sharing. Those saved images can then later be used as part of the games jigsaw puzzle system. The player can adjust the number of pieces to set the puzzle difficulty.

You can find this app:

  • Apple iTunes
  • Google Play
  • Amazon
  • Coming soon for tvOS and OS X!

A portion of the proceeds go to Rocket Dog Rescue, a rescue group that places dogs in approved homes.

What can you create with Corona SDK?

Want to see your app featured here?

Corona Labs is always looking for apps to feature. If you’ve developed an app using Corona SDK, complete our showcase submission form and you could show up in the blog, get a social media shout out, collect some cool swag or more!

item.title: Corona Geek #70 – Illustrator, App Developer Laura Tallardy On Creating Mobile Apps
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During the last Corona Geek Hangout of 2013, we talk with App Developer / Illustrator Laura Tallardy about what it's like to be both artist and app developer. Laura has an excellent portfolio of themed children's apps and several holiday themed apps that she maintains across iOS, Android, Kindle Fire, and Nook. She has an interesting story about how she made the transition from artist to app developer. Laura also shared several excellent work flow tips and her advice to just, "get it shipped" was a powerful part of the conversation.
item.content:encoded:
During the last Corona Geek Hangout of 2013, we talk with App Developer / Illustrator Laura Tallardy about what it’s like to be both artist and app developer. Laura has an excellent portfolio of themed children’s apps and several holiday themed apps that she maintains across iOS, Android, Kindle Fire, and Nook. She has an interesting story about how she made the transition from artist to app developer. Laura also shared several excellent work flow tips and her advice to just, “get it shipped” was a powerful part of the conversation.

Join us January 11th, 2014 for the first Dallas Corona SDK Meeting of the year at Reel FX’s Dallas studio. Dr. Brian Burton will be sharing information on how to build business apps using Corona SDK. Come eat pizza, meet app developers, and see where the movie animation magic happens.

Thank you to everyone who watched today’s live Corona Geek Hangout on YouTube.

Also, thank you to everyone who appeared on Corona Geek this year or was part of the weekly hangout panel.

Here are just a few names of people who shared their time and talents with us in 2013. We tried hard to include everyone, so if your name is missing we apologize. Thank you all so very much!

2013 Hangout Guests

  • Niren Hiro – Search Man SEO

  • Brian Park – Spelling Test
  • Ben Wong – Climate Clock
  • Eric Kinkead – Questlord
  • Andrea Zanetti from 16Bit Labs – Ice Hero
  • David L. Hoyt – Just 2 Words
  • Nevin Flanagan – author of Corona SDK Hotshot
  • Thomas Escourrou – Video Pixie
  • Kimberly Voll – Discussed Challenging Gender Stereotypes in Gaming
  • Eric Dyck and Phil Laird – Tap for Tap – app monetization / promotion
  • Barry Swan – from Playlevel about Graphics 2.0 (Dungeoneer / Retro Racer)
  • Doug Davies – Parental Controls code example
  • Ed Maurina – SSK Corona
  • Sergey Lerg – Graphics 2.0 Audio Visualization Demo / Skybox Demo
  • Steve P. Young – Mobile App Chat Podcast
  • Gabriel Machuret – ASO
  • Greg Pugh – Creating Children’s Apps
  • Noah Malewicz – City Birds
  • Jen Looper – Belly Dancing App
  • Dr. Brian Burton – 2.5D Isometric Perspective

2013 Hangout Panel Regulars

  • Brian Burton
  • Ed Maurina
  • Jen Looper
  • Greg Pugh
  • Gerald Bailey
  • Matthew Chapman
  • Sergey Lerg
  • Dean Murphy
  • Theo Rushin, Jr.
  • Richard Harris
  • Jay Jennings
  • David Roulin
  • Ian Masters
  • Mark Eberhardt
  • Rob Englebright
  • Rob Haney
  • Rob Miracle
  • Jesse Warden
  • Colette Levesque
  • Daniel Williams

Again, thank you all so very much. Here’s to a another great year in 2014!!

Thank you for following Corona Geek below

  • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
  • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: Corona Geek #63 – Creating Children’s Apps and Simulating 2.5D Perspective in Corona SDK
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During this week's Corona Geek we talked with children's app developer Greg Pugh about creating children's apps using Corona SDK. As a one person shop, Greg has successfully created a series of very creative interactive children's books using Corona SDK and Kwik. He shared a number of tips and insights that you'll want to hear, even you're not creating children's apps. We also, looked at code for creating 2.5D perspective using the new Graphics 2.0 engine.
item.content:encoded:
During this week’s Corona Geek we talked with cartoonist/writer/developer Greg Pugh from GP Animations about creating children’s apps using Corona SDK. As a one person shop, Greg has successfully created a series of very creative interactive children’s books using Corona SDK and Kwik. He shared a number of tips and insights that you’ll want to hear, even you’re not creating children’s apps. We also, looked at code for creating 2.5D perspective using the new Graphics 2.0 engine. We had a blast.

The deadline for the Graphics 2.0 Contest has been extended to Sunday, November 17 at 11:59pm PST. So now you have time to polish up that submission for a chance to win Corona Enterprise or an iPad mini. That’s what Ray Delia from S.K. Studios is doing. Good luck Ray!

Joining the Hangout today was:

  • Dr. Brian Burton
  • Colette Levesque
  • Ed Maurina
  • Gerald Bailey
  • Greg Pugh
  • Raymond Delia
  • Scott Sharpiro
  • Sergey Lerg
  • Theo Rushin, Jr.

… and thank you to everyone who watched the live Corona Geek Hangout on YouTube.

Congratulations to Joe Vest for winning this week’s Corona Labs’ t-shirt. For your chance to win, follow Corona Geek on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, or YouTube and complete the Corona Geek giveaway form.

Remember To Subscribe

    • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
    • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
    • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube

item.title: Corona Geek #57 – Parental Support, iOS 7, and Android Micro-Consoles
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: During this week's Corona Geek, Doug Davies walked us through the code he used to implement a parental gate using Corona SDK for his game Buttermilk - The Bouncing Baby Goat. We also discussed Green Throttle's controller update, micro-consoles, and iOS 7 support in Corona SDK.
item.content:encoded:
During this week’s Corona Geek, Doug Davies walked us through the code he used to implement a parental gate using Corona SDK for his game Buttermilk – The Bouncing Baby Goat. Doug’s game complies with child safety requirements for Apple’s new Kids App Store.

We also discussed Green Throttle’s controller update, micro-consoles, and iOS 7 support in Corona SDK.

Congratulations to Rob Englebright for winning this week’s Corona Labs’ t-shirt. For your chance to win, follow Corona Geek on Twitter and Facebook, and complete the Corona Geek giveaway form.

Thank you for watching, we’ll see you on next week’s Corona Geek! Be sure to “thumbs up” this video on YouTube if you’d like to see more code-related sessions.

Remember To Subscribe

    • Download the Corona Geek podcast on iTunes
    • Listen to Corona Geek on Stitcher
    • Subscribe to Corona Geek on YouTube
